He feels that the appearance of virtual currency bears witness to the fact that the global financial system is undergoing a tectonic shift that must be taken into account. Giancarlo went on to say that cryptocurrency is significantly enabling the improvement of the global financial system: a transparent system of payment, a decentralized system for the storage of exchange data and the speed of operations are a few of the advantages of cryptocurrency voiced by the Chair. According to the commission, the cryptocurrency market and blockchain industry in the US will play an important role in the flourishing of the American economy and improvement of the lives of Americans. Also present was SEC Chair Jay Clayton, who spoke favorably about the future of the cryptocurrency market. Clayton called digital currency a good alternative to crowdfunding for American businessmen but emphasized the need for regulation in that segment of the world economy. The crypto investor community and various crypto activists reacted positively to the speeches of the SEC and CFTC chairs. On 6 February about 80% of the news on the cryptocurrency subreddits was about the regulator's positive intentions and on how, thanks to them, cryptocurrency exchange rates stopped dropping. It is Finom's opinion that this is a landmark event for the crypto world, as the regulators have once again confirmed that cryptocurrency is not a bubble supported by the expenses of miners and that it has a bright future ahead of it in the world economy. #finom_news

Body: Bitcoin vs. Gold  Last week, the World Gold Council published a statement declaring that neither bitcoin nor any other cryptocurrency should be compared to that most important of precious metals.  "Cryptocurrencies may become an established part of the financial system. But, in our view, gold is very different from cryptocurrencies," the WGC said in its statement to investors.  Among the advantages of gold given by the Council are its low volatility, market liquidity, and its well-established regulatory framework.  "These characteristics underpin gold's role as a mainstream financial asset that will likely continue to resonate in today's digital world," the Council added. The WGC stresses gold's historical importance, stating that gold has been a source of income in constant competition with the stock market and has performed well during periods of inflation.  The WGC notes that while cryptocurrency's rise in value has been remarkable, its purpose as an investment is cardinally different from that of gold.  Over the last four decades, gold has demonstrated a rather tame volatility. Bitcoin, on the other hand, has shown a sudden surge in price over the last few years, rising over fifteen times its previous value just in the past year.Unfortunately, bitcoin was forced to pay for its high volatility in the form of a significant price correction, losing 40% of its value in a single month.  Moreover, the WGC clarified that it's not worth comparing bitcoin to gold if only because of their different sources of demand. Gold is owned by central banks and institutional investors, but consumers also own gold in the form of jewellery, representing 50-60% of annual demand. Bitcoin, on the other hand, is intended for use in electronic payment systems.  Due to these and other differences, it's useless to compare bitcoin to gold. Each asset has its own advantages and can be used in different situations.

Body: Very popular misconception about Bitcoin tha it is a distributed public ledger or something to that effect.  In fact, it is not.   Bitcoin is a decentralized replicated public ledger.  Decentralized means that it does not live on a centralized server: anybody can in principle add to it.  Replicated means that it is copied in full in a lot of places.   Distributed means that parts of it put in different place.  There is actually a very big difference.  Replication means it is fast to read data for everybody.But it also means that itâs expensive to write data.  Distributed means that it is fast to read and write data that is âclose toâ you, but it takes a long time â might even be impossible â to read/write data that is not.  The replicated nature of the blockchain means that it is fast to see how many Bitcoins you (or anybody else) have, but takes forever to spend them.    #finom_opinion

The registration and transfer of property and patents is a bureaucratic process that can drag on for months. But despite the systemâs clumsiness, it remained the only way to guarantee a deal.  However, imagine an âinternet of securitiesâ â an open database of funds and transactions. Any assets, from money to media rights, are exchanged, moved and stored online. Blockchain technology offers you a decentralized system in which the guarantor is a distributed ledger. It is open to all and reproduced on millions of computers, which allows anyone to easily determine what belongs to whom. All transactions take place instantaneously and free of commission, with no confiscation of property or taxation ever possible.  The fresh example of Belarus demonstrates how the incorporation of a decree on the regulation of cryptocurrency and blockchains can turn any country into a genuine paradise for fans of digital money, and attract an array of IT startups from all over the world. The result is a rather large amount of information which cannot possibly be combined into a single convenient register. As a result, hapless patients are forced to go from clinic to clinic, gathering up endless documents and medical records like grains of rice.  But if we put all that human data into a blockchain, weâll get a unique document, a digital medical record with exhaustive information about the state of a personâs health. Since the system retains all the qualities of a blockchain, itâs accessible worldwide, secure and has a unified structure. Also, such a system of electronic medical records will provide a wide scope for research into the causes of illnesses and for new forms of treatment like Appleâs HealthKit.  Such ideas about integrating blockchain into the medical field have already found resonance among developers all over the world. Body: There is only one Blockchain  In the internet you can see term âThe Blockchainâ which makes us think that thereâs one and only blockchain in the world. But there are many different technologies that go by the name Blockchain.  The common denominator is refers to platforms sheared up by crypto, distributed and having some form of consensus mechanism.  In the 2015th the creator of Etherium Vitalik Buterin distinguished three main types of Blockchain:  - fully private blockchains: âwriteâ permissions are kept centralized in one organization, âreadÂ» permissions may be public or restricted to an arbitrary extent.  - blockchain owned by consortium: federated Blockchains operate under the leadership of a group. As opposed to public Blockchains, they donât allow any person with access to the Internet to participate in the process of verifying transactions. Federated Blockchains are faster (higher scalability) and provide more transaction privacy.  - public blockchains: state of the art public Blockchain protocols based on Proof of Work (PoW) consensus algorithms are open source and not permissioned. Anyone can participate, without permission.  As we can see there are can be many blockchains extisting, and they are of different types. Every type has certain strengths and weaknesses. Each can become useful in some situations, so itâs chosen according to the needs of the project. #finom_opinion
